00014 // .NAME vtkMrmlDataVolume - Object used in the slicer to perform
00015 // everything related to the access and display of image data (volumes).
00016 // .SECTION Description
00017 // Used in conjunction with a vtkMrmlDataVolumeNode (which neatly describes
00018 // display settings, file locations, etc.).  Essentially, the MRML 
00019 // node gives the high level description of what this class should 
00020 // actually do with the ImageData.
00021 // 
00022

00058   // Description:
00059   // Provides opportunity to insure internal consistency before access. 
00060   // Transfers all ivars from MrmlNode to internal VTK objects
00061   // Also causes ImageData's source (if any) to update itself.

00065   // Description:
00066   // Set the image data
00067   // Use GetOutput to get the image data.
00068   vtkSetObjectMacro(ImageData, vtkImageData);
00069   vtkImageData* GetOutput();

00072   // Description:
00073   // Read/Write image

00080 
00081   //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00082   // Read/Write volume data contained by this object.
00083   // This sub-object is specific to each
00084   // type of volume that needs to be read in.  This can be used
00085   // to clean up the special cases which handle
00086   // volumes of various types, such as dicom, header, etc.  In
00087   // future these things can be moved here.  Each read/write 
00088   // sub-object corresponds to a vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode subclass.
00089   // These subclasses write any needed info in the MRML file.
00090   //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00091   vtkSetObjectMacro(ReadWrite,vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWrite);
00092   vtkGetObjectMacro(ReadWrite,vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWrite);
00093 
00094   // Description:
00095   // Set Histogram attributes
00096   void SetHistogramHeight(int h) {this->HistPlot->SetHeight(h);};
00097   void SetHistogramWidth(int w);
00098   vtkSetVector3Macro(HistogramColor, vtkFloatingPointType);
00099 
00100   // Description:
00101   // Get Histogram plot (an image)
00102   vtkImageData *GetHistogramPlot();
00103 
00104   int GetBimodalThreshold() {return this->Bimodal->GetThreshold();};
00105 
00106   // Description:
00107   // Assumes GetHistogramPlot has already been called
00108   int MapBinToScalar(int b) {return this->HistPlot->MapBinToScalar(b);};
00109   int MapScalarToBin(int s) {return this->HistPlot->MapScalarToBin(s);};

00111   // Description:
00112   // Set/Get window/level/threshold slider range

00120 
00121   void StackSetPolygon(int window, vtkPoints *poly, int s, int p, int d,
00122                        int closed, int preshape, int label)
00123   {
00124     switch (window)
00125     {
00126       case 0: this->AxiPolyStack->SetPolygon(poly, s, p, d, closed, preshape,
00127                                              label);
00128               break;
00129       case 1: this->SagPolyStack->SetPolygon(poly, s, p, d, closed, preshape,
00130                                              label);
00131               break;
00132       case 2: this->CorPolyStack->SetPolygon(poly, s, p, d, closed, preshape,
00133                                              label);
00134               break;
00135     }
00136   };
00137   void StackRemovePolygon(int window, int s, int p)
00138   {
00139     switch (window)
00140     {
00141       case 0: this->AxiPolyStack->RemovePolygon(s, p);
00142               break;
00143       case 1: this->SagPolyStack->RemovePolygon(s, p);
00144               break;
00145       case 2: this->CorPolyStack->RemovePolygon(s, p);
00146               break;
00147     }
00148   };
00149 
00150   void RasStackRemovePolygon(int window, int s, int p)
00151   {
00152     switch (window)
00153     {
00154       case 0: this->AxiRasPolyStack->RemovePolygon(s, p);
00155               break;
00156       case 1: this->SagRasPolyStack->RemovePolygon(s, p);
00157               break;
00158       case 2: this->CorRasPolyStack->RemovePolygon(s, p);
00159               break;
00160     }
00161   };
00162   void RasStackSetPolygon(int window, vtkPoints *rasPoly, int s, int p, int d,
00163                           int closed, int preshape, int label)
00164   {
00165     switch (window)
00166     {
00167       case 0: this->AxiRasPolyStack->SetPolygon(rasPoly, s, p, d, closed,
00168                                                 preshape, label);
00169               break;
00170       case 1: this->SagRasPolyStack->SetPolygon(rasPoly, s, p, d, closed,
00171                                                 preshape, label);
00172               break;
00173       case 2: this->CorRasPolyStack->SetPolygon(rasPoly, s, p, d, closed,
00174                                                 preshape, label);
00175               break;
00176     }
00177   };
